summary: This is an email chain from January 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) staff discussing access to scanned documents from the Florida investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reference draft indictments, defense attorney letters, and the need for shared drive access to review the materials.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email providing information about accessing scanned Epstein investigation documents, including defense letters and draft indictments, on a shared drive.

persons.name: Abigail
persons.context: Appears as a recipient in an email chain, likely a colleague at the SDNY, involved in the discussion about obtaining scanned documents from the Florida Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Kurland
persons.context: Identified as the Deputy Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting progress on obtaining scanned documents, including draft indictments and defense submissions, from the Florida trip.

persons.name: Lou
persons.context: Mentioned as the person to contact for share drive access to facilitate the transfer of large files related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; the emails discuss accessing scanned documents from the Florida investigation into him, including draft indictments and defense attorney letters.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, communicating about document access for the Epstein case.
Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office; Alex is facilitating document access in response to a request from Kurland.
Kurland, as a Deputy Chief in the Public Corruption Unit, is involved in the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, as evidenced by his request for case documents.

events.title: Email Request for Epstein Investigation Documents
events.description: Kurland emails Abigail asking for progress on obtaining scanned documents from a trip, specifically draft indictments and defense submissions related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Email Providing Document Access Information
events.description: Alex responds to an email chain, confirming receipt of files and outlining how to access defense letters and draft indictment materials for the Epstein case on a shared drive.

events.title: Email Forwarding Document Information
events.description: An email is forwarded with the subject 'Epstein', containing the prior chain about accessing investigation documents, with the note 'Prepare to be disgusted.'

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: In January 2019, SDNY prosecutors were actively seeking and organizing scanned documents from the prior Florida investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The documents referenced include draft indictments and letters from Epstein's defense attorneys, indicating a review of the historical case materials.
The email subject line and note 'Prepare to be disgusted' suggests the content of the documents was considered shocking or disturbing.
The communication shows coordination within the SDNY's Public Corruption Unit regarding the Epstein case file access.
File paths indicate the documents were stored on a government shared drive under a case reference 'USvEpstein-2018R01618'.
